metadata.title: Line-transect Survey of Marine Mammals of the SE Bering Sea

creators.name: Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC)

metadata.description:
During June 1999, we will conduct a line transect survey of marine mammals in conjunction with NOAA/AFSC/MACE cruise dedicated to hydroacoustic assessments of pollock in the Bering Sea.  A mesoscale synoptic and will cross the shelf from outer Bristol Bay to west of the Pribilof Islands, extending as far as the Inner Front (50 misobath) on the shelf.  A single towed hydrophone (200 Hz to 22khz and 30 kHz to 150 kHz) with collect acoustic data.  Air and information (ocean temperature, salinity, chlorophyll content)  

[ An NPMR project ]  [ Reference: Tynan, C.T. 2004. Cetacean populations on the southeastern Bering Sea shelf during the late 1990s: Implications for decadal changes in ecosystem structure and carbon flow. Marine Ecology Progress Series (in press) ]
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Data supporting NPMR project "Oceanographic and ecological factors influencing the occurrence patterns of whales in the Southeast Bering Sea"
